snippet: Lower numbers of people detained under the stop-and-frisk program are good, but the real question is whether the searches are productive and legal.
abstract: Editorial welcomes fact that the New York City Police Department has significantly reduced the number of people detained under its unpopular search-and-frisk program, but questions whether the trend toward racial discrimination has truly subsided.
lead_paragraph: Lower numbers of people detained under the stop-and-frisk program are good, but the real question is whether the searches are productive and legal.
